fine_dining.name: Pedro Lemos
signature_dishes: Sea Bass with Shellfish and Coastal Greens
fine_dining.atmosphere: Elegant and intimate in a renovated stone house
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book several weeks in advance; Porto's premier fine dining experience
fine_dining.local_tips: Chef Pedro Lemos creates sophisticated dishes focused on local ingredients; beautiful terrace in summer; tasting menu recommended for the full experience.

fine_dining.name: Antiqvvm
fine_dining.atmosphere: Refined dining with gardens and river views
fine_dining.booking_tips: Reserve 2-3 weeks ahead; request a table with river views
fine_dining.local_tips: Located in the historic Casa de Almeida Garrett with stunning views; chef Vitor Matos blends traditional Portuguese flavors with innovative techniques; excellent wine pairings.

fine_dining.name: The Yeatman Gastronomic Restaurant
signature_dishes: Skate Wing with Smoked Butter and Caviar
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book 1-2 months in advance; specify any dietary requirements early
fine_dining.local_tips: Chef Ricardo Costa's flagship restaurant inside The Yeatman Hotel; exceptional wine service focusing on Portuguese varieties; one of the best views across Porto; request a window table.

casual_dining.name: Cervejaria Brasão
casual_dining.atmosphere: Lively brasserie with beautiful vintage decor
casual_dining.booking_tips: No reservations; expect to wait during peak hours
casual_dining.local_tips: Considered by many to serve the best Francesinha in Porto; good craft beer selection; multiple locations but Aliados venue in historic building is most impressive.

casual_dining.name: Casa Guedes
signature_dishes: Pernil (Roast Pork Sandwich with Serra Cheese)
casual_dining.booking_tips: No reservations; counter service; be prepared to wait during peak hours
casual_dining.local_tips: Simple sandwich shop with cult following; the pork with Serra cheese sandwich is legendary; fast service but tiny venue; consider takeaway if busy.

casual_dining.name: Cantinho do Avillez Porto
signature_dishes: Flaked Cod with Bread Crumbs, LDV Olive Oil and Egg
casual_dining.booking_tips: Reservations recommended, especially for dinner; book a few days ahead
casual_dining.local_tips: Porto outpost of celebrated chef José Avillez; more casual than his fine dining venues; good value tasting menu available; excellent Portuguese wine selection.

casual_dining.name: Tapabento
casual_dining.atmosphere: Cozy restaurant in former storage room of São Bento station
casual_dining.booking_tips: Reservations essential; book at least a week ahead; small space fills quickly
casual_dining.local_tips: Innovative Portuguese cuisine with tapas-style service; intimate setting; excellent wine list; portions are generous despite the tapas concept.

street_food.name: Café Santiago
specialties: Francesinha (iconic Porto sandwich with meat, cheese, spicy sauce)
street_food.local_tips: One of the most famous places for Porto's signature Francesinha sandwich; often has queues; order with a cold Super Bock beer as locals do.

street_food.name: Manteigaria
street_food.local_tips: Originally from Lisbon but now in Porto; watch them being made; bell rings when fresh batch comes out of the oven; best enjoyed warm with cinnamon.

street_food.name: Gazela
specialties: Cachorrinhos (thin hot dog with spicy sauce and cheese)
street_food.local_tips: Anthony Bourdain-approved hot dog joint; simple but delicious; pair with cold beer; often crowded with locals late at night.

coffee_shops.name: Majestic Café
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Ornate Art Nouveau interior with wood, mirrors and chandeliers
coffee_shops.food_options: Pastries, light meals, traditional Portuguese snacks
coffee_shops.local_tips: Historic café opened in 1921; allegedly where J.K. Rowling started writing Harry Potter; touristy but worth a visit for the stunning interior; come early to avoid lines.

coffee_shops.name: Café Candelabro
coffee_shops.food_options: Simple snacks, cheese and charcuterie boards
coffee_shops.local_tips: Half bookstore, half café-bar; popular with local writers and artists; good selection of art books; transitions from café to bar in the evening; great place to meet locals.

coffee_shops.name: Combi Coffee
must_try: House Roasted Beans to Take Home
coffee_shops.local_tips: Serious coffee enthusiasts' destination; baristas roast their own beans; educational about coffee origins and brewing methods; try their coffee tasting flights.

bars.name: Vinologia
bars.local_tips: Extensive port selection from small producers not commonly found elsewhere; knowledgeable staff offer excellent education about port styles; good value tasting flights.

bars.name: Capela Incomum
bars.atmosphere: Converted chapel with stained glass and religious elements
bars.local_tips: Unique setting in a deconsecrated chapel; focus on wines from northern Portugal; intimate atmosphere with seating at old church pews; great for date night.

bars.name: The Gin House
signature_drinks: Custom G&Ts with over 150 gin varieties
bars.local_tips: Portugal's first bar dedicated to gin; each G&T served in balloon glasses with specific botanicals to complement the gin; bartenders very knowledgeable about different gin styles.

bars.name: Candelabro
bars.local_tips: Popular with local creatives and intellectuals; browse books while enjoying drinks; transforms from quiet afternoon café to buzzing bar in evenings; good place to meet locals.

food_tours.name: Taste Porto Food Tours
highlights: Visit to Bolhão Market and traditional tascas
food_tours.booking_tips: Book well in advance; Downtown Food Tour is their most popular option; wear comfortable shoes.

food_tours.name: Porto Walkers Food Tour
food_tours.booking_tips: Focuses on family-run establishments; combines food with city highlights; advance booking essential.

food_tours.name: The Douro Valley Food & Wine Tour
food_tours.booking_tips: Full-day excursion from Porto; includes transportation; brings you to the source of port wine production; book at least a week ahead.

cooking_classes.name: Cooking Porto
what_you_learn: Classic Porto dishes like Tripas à Moda do Porto
includes: Market visit option, all ingredients, recipe booklet, full meal with wines
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Hands-on classes in English; market visit recommended for full cultural experience; vegetarian options available on request.

cooking_classes.name: Porto Cooking Class at Mercado Bom Sucesso
includes: Market shopping experience, cooking instruction, meal with wine pairings
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Located in a working market; focuses on seasonal ingredients; intimate experience with local chef; book at least a week ahead.

markets.name: Mercado do Bolhão
markets.hours: 8 AM - 8 PM (Monday-Friday), 8 AM - 6 PM (Saturday), Closed Sunday
markets.local_tips: Historic market operating since 1839; recently renovated while preserving traditional character; best in mornings when all vendors are open; look for the iconic verbal 'advertising' from vendors.

markets.name: Mercado Bom Sucesso
markets.local_tips: Modern take on market concept; good place for casual meals with many options; popular with locals for after-work drinks and dinner; more contemporary than traditional.

markets.name: Feira da Vandoma
markets.local_tips: Porto's traditional flea market; some food vendors offer local specialties; great place to hunt for unique souvenirs while sampling local snacks.

spring: Peas with poached eggs and chouriço
summer: Tripas à moda do Porto (Tripe with white beans - traditional dish that gave Porto citizens their nickname 'Tripeiros')
Sopa de Pedra (Stone Soup with beans and various meats)
autumn: Castanhas assadas (Roasted chestnuts from street vendors)
Toucinho do céu (Almond and egg yolk dessert popular around All Saints' Day)
winter: Francesinhas (Perfect comfort food for cold weather)
Rojões à Minhota (Fried pork with potatoes)
Rabanadas (Porto-style French toast soaked in wine or port, traditional Christmas dessert)
